name: Shiitake
description: The Shiitake (Lentinula edodes) is the second most cultivated edible mushroom worldwide after the button mushroom and an important medicinal mushroom. It originates from East Asia where it grows naturally on Shii trees and other hardwoods. The compound lentinan is approved as a cancer medicine in Japan. Shiitake is rich in vitamin D and has immunostimulating, antiviral and cholesterol-lowering properties.
